content: in this case a plaintiff and a defendant were involved in a legal dispute regarding the division of a jointly owned apartment the plaintiff claimed that they were married to the defendant and that they had bought the apartment together after the marriage ended the plaintiff continued to live in the apartment and pay for all expenses on their own the defendant expressed interest in dividing the property in the future the plaintiff requested that the apartment be considered their sole property and that they be compensated for the expenses they had incurred both parties presented their arguments and evidence to the court the court ruled that the plaintiff should be awarded ownership of the apartment but the defendant should be compensated for their expenses the court also determined that the procedural costs of the case would be divided between the parties the plaintiff paid a state fee of 300 euros to file the lawsuit and both parties are responsible for their own procedural costs
